newsitem.title: USA: PC Quote loses Charles Schwab contract.
newsitem.headline: PC Quote loses Charles Schwab contract.

text.p: PC Quote Inc, which provides online stock and market quotes, said the company's agreement to provide securities quotes and financial news to Charles Schwab & Co offices across the United States will end on December 31.
In a statement released late Wednesday, the company said the agreement made up 10 percent of PC Quote's overall revenues.

"This working agreement has been beneficial for both companies, but we were unable to resolve some pricing issues in our latest round of service negotiations," Howard Meltzer, president and chief operating officer, said.
"We do hope to be able to work with Schwab again at some point in the future," he said.
PC Quote said it is seeing new revenues from its Internet products and services, in subscriptions, co-branding and advertising, which will help offset the short-term revenue loss.
In addition, PC Quote said it will now accelerate its efforts to close on other current revenue opportunities.
"We have a lot of seeds planted right now," Meltzer said. "We are talking to other financial institutions about adding our on-line quotes and news products."

The company said it has seen increased interest in its recently-launched electronic equities transaction product called RealTrade, and it is working on further ways to leverage its agreement with Microsoft Excel 97.
